comments.content: Lego is a logo- for sure.
obviously it’s a logo but what font is used for the logo or the topic headings on their site....OR what font comes closest to their logo??

What Mike means is that it was designed as a logo, not a font. You might be able to get close with [Chevin Extra Bold Italic,](http://web.archive.org/web/20090519202736/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=GTT0000003#flont) but it’s a lot more rigid than the Lego logo.

As for the font on the website, I don’t know it.

- Lex
